entry.title: Setting Up Cloud TMS for Various SAP SaaS Solutions
entry.content:
Although I‚Äôve spent over 18 years in the SAP ecosystem and have written countless documents for both companies and customers, this is my first time writing a blog post for the SAP Community. Excited (and a bit curious) to see how it goes!üòâ

As we transition into the cloud era, the way we work is rapidly evolving. For years, we‚Äôve relied on the classic STMS transaction for managing SAP transports. Over time, we saw the introduction of tools like CTS+ and HTA for non-ABAP systems, yet STMS has remained a mainstay ‚Äî and likely will continue to be, as long as SAP runs on-premise or in private cloud environments.

But with the advent of SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), things are shifting. SAP is now encouraging the use of cloud-native transport mechanisms to move code into production. This brings us to Cloud Transport Management ‚Äî also known as CTMS.

Many have already written blogs about setting up Cloud Transport Management (CTMS). However, in this blog, I‚Äôd like to take you through the CTMS setup for various SAP SaaS applications that I‚Äôve had the opportunity to work on. Think of this as a one-stop guide for integrating CTMS with most of the SAP SaaS solutions available on SAP BTP.

Let's dive into it...

What is Cloud Transport Management and why do we need it? 

As many of you already know, it's a service in BTP, lets you manage software deliverables between accounts of different environments (such as Cloud Foundry, ABAP, and Neo). It also adds transparency to the audit trail of changes so that you get information about who performed which changes in your production environment, and when they did it.

Benefits and Features:

  • Better control of changes
  • Fully cloud-based
  • Integrated experience
  • Transport various types of content
  • Transport to different environments
  • Set up your transport landscape quickly
  • Complement CI/CD approaches
  • Flexibly handle imports

Supported Content Types:

  1. Multitarget Application archives (MTAs -.mtar files)
  2. BTP ABAP
  3. Application content
  4. Delivery units (DUs) of SAP HANA XS classic model

Plans and Pricing:

Setup Scenarios:

cTMS Setup is based on below 2 Scenarios

1.Transporting Content Archives Directly in the Application

  • Configure Entitlement
  • Subscribe to the cTMS Service
  • Set up the Role Collection
  • Create the Service Instance and Key

2.Transporting Content Archives from a Local File System

  • Configure Entitlement
  • Subscribe to the cTMS Service
  • Set up the Role Collection

Setup Steps:

Most of these SaaS applications follow scenario 1 here

Step1: Configuring Entitlement for cTMS

First, decide which subaccount should host the Cloud Transport Management Service (cTMS). You can either:

  • Use an existing subaccount where your applications are already running, or

  • Set up a dedicated subaccount solely for cTMS.

Recommendation: If cost is not a limiting factor, it's best to use a separate subaccount to keep transport management isolated and maintain a cleaner architecture.

Once you've selected the subaccount, follow these steps to assign entitlements:

  1. Go to your Global Account.

  2. Navigate to Entitlements > Entity Assignments.

  3. Select the subaccount where you want to subscribe to cTMS.

  4. Click on Configure Entitlements.

  5. Click Add Service Plans.

  6. Search for Cloud Transport Management.

  7. Under the service details, choose the appropriate service plans.

  8. Click Add Service Plans to finalize the entitlement.

Step2: Subscribe to cTMS

In the subaccount, navigate to Services ‚Üí Service Marketplace and search for Cloud Transport Management.

Click on Actions and select Create.

In the dialog that appears, choose Standard Plan from the Plan dropdown menu, then click Create to proceed

Subscribed

Click Go to Application to launch the Cloud Transport Management (cTMS) application.

Step3: Setting Up Role Collections

To configure user access and permissions, set up role collections for the various roles available in Cloud Transport Management (cTMS).

After a successful subscription, SAP Cloud Transport Management provides two predefined role collections:

  • TMS_LandscapeOperator_RC for the Landscape Operator role

  • TMS_Viewer_RC for the Viewer role

These role templates are available by default, but you can also create custom role collections if needed and assign them to users accordingly. Typically, most team members are assigned the Viewer role, while the Admin role is managed by the SAP Basis team.

Step4: Create a Service Instance and Key

To create a service instance, ensure that a space has been set up in your subaccount.

  1. Navigate to Services ‚Üí Instances and Subscriptions in your subaccount.

  2. Click Create to start the instance creation wizard.

  3. In the wizard, select the appropriate plan, runtime environment, space, and name for the service instance.

  4. Click Create to complete the setup.

Once the service instance is created, proceed to create a service key within the instance.

Important:
Do not share the service key via email or chat, as it contains sensitive credentials. Handle it securely. This key will be required when configuring destinations in your subaccount.

Step5: Configure the Landscape

Please go through below links for each SaaS Application specific Setup. 

  • cTMS Setup for CAP Applications
  • cTMS Setup for SAP Build Work Zone
  • cTMS Setup for SAP Datasphere
  • cTMS Setup for SAP SAC
  • cTMS Setup for Transporting BTP Role Collections
  • cTMS Setup for IntegrationSuite (CPI)

Step6: Integrate with Solution Manager

To integrate Cloud Transport Management (cTMS) with SAP Solution Manager (ChaRM / Focused Build), follow these steps:

1. Setup RFC Destinations in SAP Solution Manager

a. TMS_AUTHENTICATION

  • Host: <your-subaccount>.authentication.<domain>.com
    (Refer to the service key for the exact value)

  • Port: 443

  • Path Prefix: /oauth/token

  • Authentication Type: Basic Authentication

    • Use Client ID and Client Secret from the service key

  • SSL: Active

b. TMS_REST_API

  • Host: URI from the service key

  • Port: 443

  • Path Prefix: (leave blank)

  • Authentication: Do not use a user

  • SSL: Active

2. Create External Service in LMDB

In LMDB, create an External Service of type System using the following parameters:

  • Is Cloud TMS Node: X

  • Cloud TMS Node Name: Name of the node in cTMS (case-sensitive)

  • Cloud TMS Authentication RFC: TMS_AUTHENTICATION

  • Cloud TMS REST API RFC: TMS_REST_API

3. ChaRM / Focused Build Configuration

  • Assign the External Service to a Logical Component Group.

  • Link the Logical Component Group to your Solution.

  • Redefine the landscape within Solution Manager.

Step7: Integrate with Cloud ALM

If you're ready to integrate with Cloud ALM, the setup is straightforward. Simply create the following destination in your Cloud ALM subaccount. Keep in mind that you have separate Global and subaccounts for Cloud ALM. 

Name: use the prefix CALM_FTR_CTMS_

URL: Value of uri from the service key of your cTMS Service Key.

Authentication: OAuth2ClientCredentials

Client id, Secret from cTMS Service Key

Token Service URL: Value of URL (uaa section) from the service key

Conclusion: 

Now that you've learned what Cloud Transport Management (cTMS) is, including its benefits, cost, and how to subscribe and setup, what would be the best deployment approach. Should you keep cTMS within an existing subaccount, or create a dedicated one? You've also seen how cTMS can be integrated with both Solution Manager (SolMan) and Cloud ALM to enable change & deployment. 

Thank you for reading my blog and appreciate your feedback or any questions. 

Thanks,
Raghu

entry.title: Workarounds for Planning inconsistancies occuring due to MRP live
entry.content:
Planning Inconsistency during MRP run using MRP live

Introduction

             Material Requirements Planning (MRP) is one of the core components within the Production Planning module of SAP ERP. Its primary function is to ensure material availability by systematically evaluating demand (PIR, CIR, S/O), existing inventory and procurement proposals (PRs/POs), and generating new proposals to bridge any identified shortages. This is essential for smooth production operations and timely delivery schedules

             As the 21st century unfolded, it ushered into a new age ‚Äì The digital age, the Fourth Industrial Revolution (4IR), our period is marked by rapid digital transformation across industries. Every facet of the supply chain is being shifted toward digitization as much as possible, driven by the need for increased speed, transparency, efficiency, connectivity and scalability. At the same time, the volume and complexity of global business transactions surged, placing unprecedented pressure on legacy systems.

            In response to these evolving market needs, enterprise resource planning systems required a significant upgrade. The modern market needs 4IR compliant features such as such as high-capacity data storage and data retrieval, cloud computing, integration with IoT networks, intelligent automation through AI-ML and system scalability.

            Recognizing this shift, SAP launched its next-generation business suite‚ÄîSAP S/4HANA‚Äîin February 2015. One of its most transformative innovations (P.P. POV) was the introduction of MRP Live, a high-performance planning engine designed to meet the demands of real-time, data-driven operations, built to leverage the power of the HANA database, executes complex planning scenarios at unprecedented speed, with scalability and transparency tailored to the digital enterprise.

            However, as with any emerging technology during it‚Äôs infancy, MRP live also has it‚Äôs own constraints. More details of its restrictions are available on S/Note: 1914010. This article describes a scenario of planning inconsistency of MRP live and a work around to fix it.

Disclaimer

This observation is shared purely for educational purposes only and pertains to a specific scenario. MRP Live is a powerful and innovative tool, with high flexibility and possess robust cross-plant planning capabilities. The behavior noted here is an outlier case within a highly complex program. While a temporary workaround is suggested, it‚Äôs important to emphasize that, the final solution must come from SAP, as part of their continuous product improvement and support lifecycle."

Business Scenario

The material is maintained as a project stock. We maintain a planned independent requirement and procure the components, at the same time, we also receive sales orders. Sales order consumes PIR. Basically, it follows Planning with Final assembly, but with two changes:

  1. Since it‚Äôs under project stock, therefore for CIR, we assign assignment category ‚ÄúQ‚Äù
  2. The business scenario is such that, when S/O is created, Production order also need to be created automatically.

Configurations 

Practice scenario:

PIR:

Sales Order:

Stock Requirements screen:

We can observe two things

  1. Sales Order has consumed PIR.
  2. Production orders are created without MRP run as soon as Sales orders are saved.

Now Planning run using MRP live

 

Stock Requirements screen:

Pic: A

Creating a second sales order and executing MRP live:

Pic B

Observations

  1. Sales order consuming PIR properly ‚Äì Working as per standard.
  2. Compare Pic A & B, for Planned orders created from PIR, the latest sales order details are populated, to its account assignment category ‚Äì Planning inconsistency

Workarounds

Option 1: T-code: MD_MRP_FORCE_CLASSIC

To correct this planning inconsistency, we must force this material to plan in classic MRP, no matter if planning run is done via classic MRP or MRP live. Refer to S/Note: 2883907 for further information. Although we get the correct planning results, we lose the advantages of MRP live.

Planning run with MRP live.

Result

Observation:

  1. Now the S/O order details are not being populated to Planned orders created from PIRs, therefore no planning inconsistancies.

Option 2: Activate ‚ÄúAssign effectivity parameter values/ override change numbers‚Äù

Turn off the Classic MRP check box

Now when planned using MRP live, material will be again planned under MRP live program, leading to planning inconsistancies.

Now activate Assign effect. vals

Although the purpose of Assign effect. Vals is different, but according to S/Note: 1914010, MRP Live on HANA does not support parameter effectivity. Therefore, by default, the materials will be planned by Classic MRP.

These are the two workarounds to force materials to be planned using Classic MRP.

Summary

1. Although, MRP live is a very powerful tool, it has it's own limitations (S/Note: 1914010), that can cause inconsistancies in planning. Therefore sometimes we need to force the material to plan in Classical MRP at the cost of MRP live advantages. 

2. To force material to plan in classic MRP, use T-code: MD_MRP_FORCE_CLASSIC, and check the classic MRP box.

3. If you consider, MD_MRP_FORCE_CLASSIC, as additional step, you can simply check the "Assign effect. Vals" in basic data 1 view of material master. Although it's puspose is different, it server the purpose in this case.

entry.title: Is there a way to extract open accounting periods in public cloud?
entry.content:
Hi Dear Experts,

We are evaluating an interface to transfer sales data from an external system to SAP.
According to standard SAP behavior, I understand that when an accounting period is closed, posting a sales document (billing document) will result in a "Planned Posting" status.
This means the billing document can be created or updated, but it will not be posted to the general ledger (no accounting document is generated).

Problem Statement:
If a billing document cancellation is transmitted to SAP after the accounting period is closed, the billing document in SAP will be canceled.
Crucially:

  1. A canceled document cannot be "uncanceled" (reversal of cancellation is impossible).

  2. Even if a new credit memo ("Shin-Kuro Denpyo") is created, it will remain in an "Unposted" status.
    (This leads to inconsistent/incorrect data states).

Proposed Solution & Obstacle:
To prevent this, we intended to implement interface controls to block changes to billing documents after period closure.
However, our investigation revealed no standard API or CDS view to retrieve "Open" (unclosed) accounting periods in SAP Public Cloud ("Pabu Kura").
We therefore concluded that this control is currently infeasible via standard means.

Request:
Does SAP Public Cloud provide any method (e.g., API, CDS View, function module) to identify Open accounting periods?
If you have relevant information or implementation examples, we would greatly appreciate your guidance.

 

Please suggest.

Thank you very much.Best Regards!

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Finance SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sales SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: S/4HANA Service Management for Utilities - do you need help moving?
entry.content:
Are you underway or planning to implement Service Management in S/4HANA?

Please let us know if you require help or product improvements. I hope you are aware of the new features, design changes, capabilities and simplifications when moving from CS to S/4HANA Service with Advanced Execution. Here is a refresher post Service Management for Utilities in S/4HANA.

Moving from CS to S/4HANA Service can seem like a lot of change. There are two programs I want to point out that can help you, the continuous influence program and the early adopter care.

 

Continuous influence

SAP customers and partners can request standard functionalty through this program. There are different programs, one for S/4HANA Service, another one for assets and so on. Maybe you know the utilities specific program? My colleage recently provided an update on SAP Continuous Influence Session for SAP S/4HANA Utilities: Status Update July 2025

The program for S/4HANA Service Management Cloud Private Edition can be found here  https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/campaign/3679

Please participate, by voting and by creating improvement requests. There are already several open requests from utilities. Be aware of the program rules. To qualify for a review and consideration, an improvement request requires at least 10 customer votes within 18 months in this program.

This is your chance to support a requirenent by voting. Below are a few relevant requests, many of them have not reached the required theshold yet:

Submitted, open for voting:

  • Compatible Units & Estimation Support for customer requested service work https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/326114
  • Applications for electrical interconnection supported in New Service with Advanced Execution https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/326119
  • New Service with Advanced Execution https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/327458
  • Appointment processing https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/326115
  • Quotation & Tariff Rate Support for Customer requested work https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/326117

Accepted (expected to be delivered):

  • Service Request as replacement of Service Notification (CS Notification) https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/312044  

 

Early Adopter Care

Are you interested in extra support while moving from CS to S/4HANA Service? SAP customers and partners can currently apply for Early Adopter Care. The registration remains open until December 2025, please find the details and conditions here https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#campaign/3904

 

Note that an S user is required to participate in these SAP programs, see knowledge base article 3014377 - Accessing the Continuous Influence Session "SAP S/4HANA Utilities".

We welcome your input and feedback to continuously improve SAP S/4HANA Utilities.

entry.title: Re: No sufficient record found in control table
entry.content:
The issue is related to GST India: Official Document Numbering (ODN).

Please follow these steps to resolve it:

  1. Open transaction SM30 and enter the table/view name: J_1IG_V_OFNUM. Display the entries.

  2. Look for the Company Code, Business Place, and Document Class mentioned in the error message.

  3. Note down the Number Group (No. gp) and Number Range (No.) associated with these entries.

  4. Next, go to transaction SNRO and enter the object J_1IG_ODN.

  5. Choose Interval Editing, enter the noted Number Group, and select Edit Intervals.

  6. Maintain the number range as required.

After completing these steps, the issue should be resolved.

Thank you.

It's fine if the portal is not an on-premise application. The main idea is to place a reverse proxy between the CPI and the portal to restrict inbound IPs to the portal. entry.title: Re: yaai & yaai_ui ‚Äì Open-Source AI Tools for ABAP Developers
entry.content:
Hi @tlangner ,
Yes, there is an example in the documentation where you can find the steps and the code. 
https://github.com/christianjianelli/yaai_ui/blob/main/docs/code_assist.md

There are two possible ways to implement it using the SAP Enhancement SEUED001.
One is to use the menu exit +PGE, which is quite simple. The other option is to create a dynamic pattern, which requires the creation of a function module and a screen.

About the technical details on how the source code is passed to the LLM and how the LLM response is inserted into the code you can see the methods _get_abap_editor_context and _insert_code_block in the source code (link below). Note: the method _insert_code_block is not used when using a dynamic pattern.  
https://github.com/christianjianelli/yaai_ui/blob/main/src/ycl_aai_ui_code_assist.clas.abap

Best regards,
Christian

entry.title: Sales Order Changed to Complete when invoice status is Not Started
entry.content:
We have a sales order created and we delivered partially. The scenario here is the customer decided to cancel the remaining quantities. Therefore the item is cancelled through "Reason for Rejection" on the line item level. The question is why would the sales order close if we have not processed the customer invoicing? 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Sales Order Changed to Complete when invoice status i...
entry.content:
Dear requester,

When the sales order item is partially delivered, even the invoice is not yet invoiced, it is possible to cancel the remaining quantity. Since there is no open quantity in the order, the sales order becomes completed even the invoice status is Not Started. The delivery status of the item will be updated to Finished after the cancellation is saved.

The user is still able to further invoice the outbound delivery invoice request, and the invoice will then update the invoice status to Finished in the sales order afterwards.

It is confirmed with development team that this is the current designed system behavior for both manual entered sales orders and intercompany sales orders.

Thanks,

Adie

entry.title: Including Tax Information in Purchase Order Creation on SAP S/4HANA Cloud: Utilizing BAdI
entry.content:
How to Include Tax Item Information on Purchase Order output form?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Including Tax Information in Purchase Order Creation...
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, no standard CDS views are available to retrieve tax information during purchase order creation. As a result, tax values cannot be transferred to output messages at this stage.
If Tax values need to be printed on Purchase Order Forms, a custom logic implementation is required. 

Here is a potential workaround for this missing functionality:

 

1. Create custom field at item level for the Purchase Order.

2. Populate this custom field with the tax amount to be printed. Note that in the current SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition release, there are no standard CDS views available to directly retrieve tax rates or tax codes.

Workaround 1:

To implement the desired code logic, BAdI MM_PUR_S4_PO_MODIFY_ITEM can be utilized.

  • Use this BAdI to calculate the tax amount as needed.
  • I_PurOrdItmPricingElementAPI01 is not filled while the order is saved.
  • Implement the  BADI calculating the values on your own logic code. 


Workaround 2:

To implement the required code logic, the BAdI MMPUR_PO_OUTPUT_HEADER_EXT/ITEM can be used.

The BAdI MMPUR_PO_OUTPUT_HEADER_EXT/ITEM can be used to implement custom logic for VAT calculation during output generation. It should be noted that this BAdI does not update the custom fields at the database level; changes will only be reflected on the output form.

This BAdI is invoked during output determination, which takes place after the purchase order is created. At that stage, the structure I_PurOrdItmPricingElementAPI01 already contains the relevant condition type values.

3. Enable custom field for output as demonstrated in this blog.

4. Adjust custom form template with the new field included.

Disclaimer: Any custom logic implemented with BAdIs falls outside the scope of SAP Technical Support.

entry.title: Re: Remote Code Analysis in ATC ‚Äì Working with Exemptions
entry.content:
Hello again from me,

we managed to find and correct the error that caused our dynpro problem.
After some debugging and testing we checked the technical user we created for the RFC communication.

There we could see, that the usertype was set to "System". After changing it to "Service" the error was resolved and the Pop-Up for requesting exemptions is now shown without problems.

 

Kind Regards,

Dominic.

entry.title: Re: Error deleting BP ID via FM BAPI_IDENTIFICATION_REMOV...
entry.content:
You should be aware, direct updates to master data tables like BUT0ID are not recommended without SAP‚Äôs guidance. Of course, you can standardize all BP Identification Numbers to uppercase before deletion. This involves reading the existing entries from table BUT0ID, Converting the IDENTIFICATIONNUMBER field to uppercase using ABAP logic, Updating the entries via a custom report or enhancement (if allowed). Then retrying BAPI_IDENTIFICATION_REMOVE with the uppercase value.

If the above option is not viable or if data integrity is at risk, raise an incident with SAP Support referencing SAP Note 2745718. Request a workaround or enhancement that allows deletion regardless of case sensitivity. SAP may provide a patch or alternative FM that bypasses the uppercase check.

entry.title: Looking for Released CDS View for Workcenter in "Pack Outbound Deliveries" App (F1624A)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are currently working on an integration requirement for the "Pack Outbound Deliveries" app (App ID: F1624A) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

As part of the solution, we need to retrieve the Workcenter (or Packing Station) information used during the packing process. However, we are unable to identify any released CDS View that exposes this data.

We have already explored the following views:

  • I_OutboundDelivery

  • I_OutboundDeliveryItem

  • I_EWM_WarehouseTask

  • I_EWM_WarehouseTask_2

    Unfortunately, none of them provide the Workcenter or Packing Station information.

Request:

Could anyone suggest if a released CDS view is available in S/4HANA Cloud that provides the Workcenter used during packing in this app?

If not, is there an alternative approach or extension point recommended to extract this information in a public cloud-compliant manner?

Use Case:

We need this data to integrate with a third-party label printing system (BarTender) where label routing depends on the Workcenter being used.

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

THanks & Regards

VK

entry.title: Consolidating Customer Planning: Unleash Growth with SAP Revenue Growth Management‚Äôs Account Plan
entry.content:
1. The Fragmented Reality of CPG Account Management

For Key Account Managers (KAMs) in the consumer products industry, managing complex customer promotion plans is often a juggling act. You‚Äôve probably experienced the frustration of scattered information of accounts, baseline volumes, targets & measures, assortments, and trade funds‚Äîall while struggling to align your promotions with corporate KPIs. This fragmentation isn‚Äôt just inefficient; it obscures strategic insights, delays adjustments, and risks revenue leakage.

 

2. SAP Revenue Growth Management: The Unified Engine

SAP Revenue Growth Management transforms how Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) companies drive profitability. By integrating trade promotion, funds management, and analytics into a single platform, our solution turns raw data into actionable growth levers. At its core is the Account Plan ‚Äîa dynamic workspace where KAMs centralize customer strategy, align resources, and track progress against goals. Unlike siloed systems, SAP Revenue Growth Management (RGM) consolidates data across promotions, baselines, and financial targets, ensuring every action ladders up to the profit and loss (P&L).

For more information on our current capabilities, see An Overview of SAP Revenue Growth Management.  

 

3. Account Planning in Action: Three Keys to Customer-Centric Trade Promotion Success

Here‚Äôs how the Account Plan in SAP Revenue Growth Management addresses your core challenges and supports your success:

 

3.1. Centralized Customer Account Intelligence: The Heart of Your Revenue Growth Management Strategy

Building an effective promotion plan starts with knowing your customer ‚Äî from the available trade funds and product lists to baseline volumes and planned promotions. The Account Plan within SAP Revenue Growth Management centralizes all this critical information in one place, giving KAMs a holistic view of their account KPIs and metrics. 

  • Holistic Baseline and Assortment Management

The Account Plan integrates baselines‚Äîwhether imported from demand planning systems or uploaded and maintained manually‚Äîmapped clearly to the product lists assigned to that account, creating a solid foundation for promotion management. 

  • Integrated Promotion and Fund Tracking

Within an Account Plan, a KAM can have a whole picture into all related promotions and manage planned promotions directly, either in a list view or in a calendar view, along with associated trade funds allocated and tracked via SAP Revenue Growth Management‚Äôs funds management feature. This integration allows KAMs to monitor investment allocation and consumption against plan targets, avoiding surprises.

This centralization cuts tedious manual data compilation and gives KAMs a clear ‚Äúsingle source of truth‚Äù to guide their day-to-day decisions and ultimately meet growth targets. 

 

3.2. Agile Assortment Control:  Automated Selection and User Flexibility

Not every retailer stocks the same products year-round ‚Äî seasonal items, product launches, discontinuations, and regional preferences all demand flexible planning. Additionally, the product list may differ for each retailer. To effectively manage this, SAP Revenue Growth Management leverages central assortments for efficiency while enabling KAMs to keep granular control to adapt to customer-specific needs.

  • Automated Determination of Central Assortments

Assortments are predefined groups of products assigned to specific customers and sales areas for designated time periods. SAP Revenue Growth Management automatically applies the most relevant central assortment at the lowest (i.e., most granular) customer level to one or more respective account plans, sparing KAMs unnecessary manual effort.

  • User-Friendly Overrides with Product Lists

While the central assortment sets the default product scope, KAMs have the flexibility to make specific modifications on a per-account basis under the Product List, including adding or removing products and editing product validity periods that define when a product is available for inclusion into a promotion plan. These manual changes do not affect the central assortment usually managed by administrators but are clearly shown in the user interface, helping KAMs review modifications and avoid errors. 

By combining automated assortment determination with controlled flexibility, the Account Plan stays both efficient and aligned with real-world customer agreements and ever-changing market demands.

 

3.3 Intuitive Account Plan Dashboard: Visualizing Plans to Drive Actions 

Keeping multiple account plans at different levels of the customer hierarchy organized and tracked can be challenging, especially if you manage numerous retailers or regions. With SAP Revenue Growth Management, KAMs always have clear visibility into their planning progress.

  • Quick Overview with Customizable KPIs

From a predefined list, KAMs can select up to four KPIs (e.g., trade spend, volume, gross sales value, trade rate) most relevant to each account plan. Moreover, based on business requirements and priorities, one KPI can be pinned for primary display on the dashboard, empowering KAMs to monitor progress towards targets and easily identify areas requiring action. 

  • Visual Indicators for Plan Readiness

The Account Plan Dashboard page provides a quick and effective overview of the situation across all account plans managed by a KAM. On the dashboard, the pinned KPI is color-coded, green for solid plans likely to achieve goals based on current planning data and red for accounts with overspent funds or unmet goals, with key figures for other selected KPIs displayed, making it fast and intuitive to spot risks or areas needing attention, so KAMs can adjust plans and prioritize actions confidently.

This color-coded dashboard insight helps KAMs stay on top of their portfolio‚Äôs health and proactively enhance plans, maximizing their growth contribution. 

 

4. Co-Innovation: Your Strategic Partner for Customer Account Success

The Account Plan in SAP Revenue Growth Management is more than a data repository‚Äîit‚Äôs an agile, integrated workspace designed to simplify your customer account planning while driving profitability.

If you face challenges such as:

  • not having a unified dynamic workspace that consolidates key business data
  • managing seasonal product lists in an intuitive way
  • limited visibility into promotion plans and revenue targets

entry.title: Missing Post Processing for Odata Inteface - S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
I‚Äôm currently facing a challenge regarding interface design in the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud environment.

My goal is to implement an interface that fulfills two key requirements:

  1. It must support post-processing and monitoring through the Application Interface Framework (AIF) in S/4HANA Public Cloud.
  2. It must provide an immediate response with clear error codes and messages, which can be forwarded to third-party systems.

    Unfortunately, I can‚Äôt achieve both at the same time with the current options. I‚Äôm forced to make a compromise:

    • With OData APIs, I do receive immediate error messages, which is ideal for integrating with third-party systems. However, OData interfaces do not support AIF, which means I lose important capabilities like system monitoring and post-processing.
    • On the other hand, asynchronous SOAP APIs are compatible with AIF and support post-processing and monitoring. But they don‚Äôt return immediate responses, making it hard to forward real-time errors to third-party systems.

      I‚Äôm working with business scenarios like Purchase Orders, Supplier Confirmations, Inbound Deliveries, and Supplier Invoices. Each of these either:

      • Offers OData APIs with no AIF support, or
      • Provides SOAP APIs, but only asynchronous ones without real-time feedback.

        At the moment, no matter which approach I choose‚ÄîOData or SOAP‚ÄîI seem to miss out on a crucial feature. Has anyone found a workaround or best practice to bridge this gap?

        Thank you!

        kind regards, 

        Philipp

entry.title: Re: Receiving process enhancement
entry.content: One option is you can use Process-Oriented Storage Control (POSC) which allows you to define a multi-step receiving process that can include batch handling, quality inspection, and putaway in one flow. You can configure a single warehouse process type that triggers batch selection and task creation together. This reduces manual steps and ensures consistent execution.

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud ALM Integration & Exception Monitoring "Fre...
entry.content:
It is not currently possible for users to edit or otherwise alter the value for the "Frequency of event calculations" parameters. This is the intended design and not a bug. Our Developers have also verified that the value is currently fixed and cannot be edited. 

If you wish to influence the future development of SAP Cloud ALM and provide direction to our Developers in relation to this topic, please use the options outlined in this KBA: 3391676 - SAP Continuous Influence for SAP Cloud ALM

entry.title: Data Access and Export for Concur Expense - Your Digital Tax Audit Assistant
entry.content:
Simplify Tax Audits ‚Äì With Minimal Effort and Maximum Control
You can use Data Access and Export service for Concur Expense to easily face internal and external audits of your Concur expense reports.

Few clicks are enough ‚Äì and you provide the tax office or your internal audit with the exact data they want to see. No more and no less. This saves you time, reduces compliance risks, and maintains full control over your sensitive data.

The service makes it easy for you to comply with your duty to collaborate in tax audits.

Audit-relevant data at the push of a button
Whether the tax authority wants to access your billing data directly or requires a data export, every audit is tedious for your team ‚Äì from compiling the relevant evidence to securing sensitive company information. Data Access and Export simplifies this process. Tax auditors and internal auditors get a quick overview of the data on the intuitive Web interface or they use a data extract in the standardized AIS format.

If required, they can navigate to the details. This saves valuable resources on both sides for a smooth and speedy audit.

Why is this relevant for Concur Expense?
Concur Expense is the source of truth for many tax-relevant calculations and payouts. This affects value added tax, income tax, but above all the employees‚Äô wage tax.

For this reason, the tax authorities check this data during their external tax audits. Only with Data Access and Export can you quickly and easily restrict data access to the required scope and export large amounts of data in the shortest possible time.

Controlled Environment

  • Easily manage authorizations for data access
  • Quickly select requested time periods and companies
  • Limited access for tax audits

Efficient and convenient

  • Access via simple, intuitive Web interface
  • Immediate export in the established SAP audit format AIS
  • No manual effort for post-processing of exported data

Seamless integration

  • Can be enabled quickly as an add-on for Concur Expense Professional Edition. It is currently available for clients in Germany. Other countries will follow soon.
  • Deployed and managed by SAP as a web service on SAP Business Technology Platform (no own SAP BTP account required)

Want to learn more?
Your SAP Concur Customer Success Manager is here for you. For more information, visit the following pages (available only in German):

  • SAP Concur Webinar
  • Data Access and Export One Pager

BR, Martin

entry.title: Re: Webi Query Filter - Between Formula
entry.content:
in report you can build variable which will check the days between and flag them.
For example:
=If(DaysBetween([CREATIONDATE];CurrentDate())>=0 And DaysBetween([CREATIONDATE];CurrentDate())<=7) Then "show" Else "hide"

entry.title: How to evaluate an idea of custom AI scenario for your business system like SAP S/4HANA Cloud in AI
entry.content:
SAP Business AI has listed all the  pre-delivered AI Scenarios for our business systems like SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Which means once we finished the initial setup like Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Setup Guide, our end users can use the pre-delivered AI Scenarios.

In some situations, our business systems' users and other associates have some genius ideas to use LLM in the system. Then how to quickly evaluate the idea and the Effect of the idea? Give an example, in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Outbound Delivery documents are create again Sales Orders, then the routes are  determined based on route determination logic. Are there any better options? For example, can we ask LLM to give some suggestions on routes based on more information like destinations' weather forecast, or even based on some freight charge information as grounding? I don't know yet. But I can quickly evaluate my idea With SAP AI Core and SAP AI Launchpad before the developer starts to develop. 

Prerequisites:

  • SAP AI Core has been initially set up in your BTP Sub Account.
  • SAP AI Launchpad has been initially set up in your BTP Sub Account.

Steps:

1.  Prepare the data which can fetched from release API or  CDS View.  I have prepared data as the following:
{
    "DeliveryDocument": "80000000",
    "HeaderGrossWeight": "3.000",
    "HeaderNetWeight": "2.700",
    "HeaderWeightUnit": "KG",
    "HeaderVolume": "0.000",
    "HeaderVolumeUnit": "",
    "ShipFromAddress": { //from shop point address
        "CityName": "Palo Alto",
        "CompanyPostalCode": "",
        "CorrespondenceLanguage": "EN",
        "Country": "US",
        "EmailAddress": "",
        "FaxNumber": "",
        "FaxNumberExtension": "",
        "Floor": "",
        "FormOfAddress": "0003",
        "HomeCityName": "",
        "HouseNumber": "3475",
        "HouseNumberSupplementText": "",
        "MobilePhoneNumber": "",
        "PhoneNumber": "",
        "PostalCode": "94304-1355",
        "PrfrdCommMediumType": "",
        "Region": "CA",
        "RoomNumber": "",
        "StreetName": "Deer Creek",
        "StreetPrefixName": "",
        "StreetSuffixName": "",
        "TaxJurisdiction": "GA00000000"
    },
        "ShipToAddress": {   //from ship to party address
        "DeliveryDocument": "80000000",
        "PartnerFunction": "SP",
        "AddressID": "22900",
        "BusinessPartnerName1": "Domestic US Customer 1",
        "AddressTimeZone": "EST",
        "CityName": "Atlanta",
        "CompanyPostalCode": "",
        "CorrespondenceLanguage": "EN",
        "Country": "US",
        "EmailAddress": "mrinal.kanti.chanda@sap.com",
        "FaxNumber": "",
        "FaxNumberExtension": "",
        "Floor": "",
        "FormOfAddress": "0003",
        "HomeCityName": "",
        "HouseNumber": "200",
        "HouseNumberSupplementText": "",
        "MobilePhoneNumber": "",
        "PhoneNumber": "999 555 6721",
        "PostalCode": "30315-1402",
        "PrfrdCommMediumType": "",
        "Region": "GA",
        "RoomNumber": "",
        "StreetName": "Augusta Ave SE",
        "StreetPrefixName": "",
        "StreetSuffixName": "",
        "TaxJurisdiction": "GA00000000"
    }
}

 

2.  Test in SAP AI Launchpad:

I prepared the follow Sytem prompt:

You are an expert of logistic.You have received a user's outbound delivery information in JSON. The user need you to suggest a best route based outbound delivery JSON information.

 The User Prompt is the JSON file in Step 1 .

Let's test in SAP AI Launchpad with GPT-4.1.

The following is the response from GPT-4.1

Based on your outbound delivery JSON, here‚Äôs your **delivery scenario**:

- **Ship From:** 3475 Deer Creek, Palo Alto, CA 94304-1355
- **Ship To:** 200 Augusta Ave SE, Atlanta, GA 30315-1402
- **Weight:** 3.0 kg (Net: 2.7 kg)
- **Country:** US (Domestic shipment)
- **Time Zone Difference:** Palo Alto (Pacific) ‚Üí Atlanta (Eastern)
- **No special volume requirement or hazardous cargo flagged**

---

## Best Route Suggestion

### 1. **Route Options Overview**

#### **A. Air Freight**
- **Best for:** Speed (overnight or 1-2 day delivery)
- **Cost:** Highest (but the shipment weight is low, so the cost is manageable)
- **Process:**
  - Pickup from Palo Alto
  - Deliver to SFO, OAK, or SJC airport
  - Direct flight to ATL
  - Local delivery in Atlanta

#### **B. Ground Courier (Expedited)**
- **Best for:** Fast and reliable ground service (2-3 days typical with express)
- **Carriers:** FedEx, UPS, USPS Priority Express, DHL
- **Cost:** Lower than air freight, still fast for lightweight parcels

#### **C. Ground Courier (Standard)**
- **Best for:** Cost efficiency, less urgency (4-6 days)
- **Carriers:** FedEx Ground, UPS Ground, USPS Priority

---

### 2. **Recommended (Best) Route for Your Delivery**

Given your shipment details (very light, no hazardous/volume concerns), and typical business shipping needs:

#### **FedEx/UPS/DHL Express Air Service**
1. **Pickup:** Arrange for parcel pickup at 3475 Deer Creek, Palo Alto, CA.
2. **Transport:** 
   - Collected and sent same day to a regional hub (San Francisco/Oakland/San Jose for air departure).
   - Overnight air transport to Atlanta Hartsfield International Airport.
3. **Delivery:** 
   - Early-morning or same-day handoff for final-mile delivery in Atlanta.
   - Will reach consignee at 200 Augusta Ave SE, Atlanta, within 24-36 hours.

**Features:**
- **Tracking & Signature**: Included.
- **Best for:** Business-critical, customer satisfaction.
- **Estimated Delivery Time:** Next business day or 2 business days.
- **Estimated Cost:** Moderate (due to low parcel weight).

---

### 3. **Alternative: Ground Courier Service**

If premium speed is not critical:

- **FedEx Ground, UPS Ground, or USPS Priority Mail**
- Delivery estimate: 4-6 business days
- Pickup same as above, direct line haul across the US
- Cost: Lower

---

## **Suggested Carrier and Service**

- **Carrier:** FedEx, UPS, or DHL Express (all ideal for coast-to-coast shipments)
- **Service:** FedEx Priority Overnight, UPS Next Day Air Saver, or DHL Express Worldwide
- **Booking:** You can book online, arrange for pickup, label your parcel at origin. Given the low weight, most shipping managers select air express for coast-to-coast in the US.

---

### **Route Mapping Summary**

```
1. Palo Alto, CA (your facility)
      ‚Üì
2. SFO/SJC/OAK Airport (CA hub, air transfer)
      ‚Üì
3. ATL Airport (GA hub, air arrival)
      ‚Üì
4. Atlanta last-mile depot
      ‚Üì
5. 200 Augusta Ave SE, Atlanta, GA (customer)
```

---

## **Action Steps**
- Package and label your shipment.
- Get quotes from FedEx, UPS, DHL online or through your logistics provider for **air express service**.
- Book for next day pickup/drop-off.
- Share tracking with your customer.

**Note:** If your delivery is not time-critical or if budget is the priority, use a ground service instead, accepting the longer transit time.

---

**Do you need carrier recommendations, rate estimation, or step-by-step booking guidance?** Let me know how I can specifically assist next!

Of course, you can adjust the prompt or even you grounding some document information in AI Launchpad.

If the result is acceptable, then Architecture can design. Then the developer can start to realize back end with CAP NodeJS, CAP Java, RAP(Cloud ABAP), Python. The listed Languages are supported by the SAP AI SDK.

The end!

Thanks for your time!

Jacky Liu
